name: Gianna
comment info:
I can see that there is a sharp rise in the % of weekly doctor and hospital visits for upper respiratory diseases (URD) in 2022-2023 and this could be due to the resurgence of URD not only by COVID but also RSV and flu. This could make sense since people used to wear masks before to protect themselves from COVID but that is not the case anymore as mask mandates were repealed. 
the next sharp rise was during 2019-2020 and we see the sharp rise but there is more variability and oscillation of the graph due to mask mandates, isolations, and then relaxation of the mandates and quarantine measures. 
The general trend indicates that the % of weekly doctors and hospitalization increases every Dec-January. That could be exacerbated due to the winter and cold temperatures and how our immunity has to adapt to the new temperatures and the rise of respiratory illnesses. Interestingly,  the lowest % is in 2020-2021 due to isolation/quarantine and mask mandates as well as the fact that people were vaccinated at the time. 
This affects my community as we are getting ready to go to work and many people are not wearing masks at work or even at the gym where there is so much closeness.
